The banking sector anticipates a soft Q2 due to NIM decline, but expects earnings to recover from Q3.

title: Suzlon Energy shares fall over 3% but Motilal sees a rally till Rs 80. Should you buy?
summary: Suzlon Energy shares fell over 3% after Q1 profit rose 7% YoY to Rs 324 crore, missing estimates due to a Rs 134 crore deferred tax charge. Nuvama trimmed FY26/FY27 EPS estimates and cut its target price to Rs 67, while Motilal Oswal maintained a positive view with an Rs 80...
fullContent: Suzlon Energy shares fell over 3% after Q1 profit rose 7% YoY to Rs 324 crore, missing estimates due to a Rs 134 crore deferred tax charge. Nuvama trimmed FY26/FY27 EPS estimates and cut its target price to Rs 67, while Motilal Oswal maintained a positive view with an Rs 80 target, citing improving execution and earnings.

title: ONGC shares in focus after mixed Q1 results
summary: ONGC shares: ONGC posted an 18.2% YoY rise in Q1FY26 consolidated net profit to ₹11,554.21 crore, even as revenue fell 3.2% to ₹1,63,108 crore. Standalone profit dropped 10.2% YoY to ₹8,024 crore but grew 24% QoQ, while standalone revenue slid 9.3% YoY to ₹32,003 crore.
fullContent: ONGC shares: ONGC posted an 18.2% YoY rise in Q1FY26 consolidated net profit to ₹11,554.21 crore, even as revenue fell 3.2% to ₹1,63,108 crore. Standalone profit dropped 10.2% YoY to ₹8,024 crore but grew 24% QoQ, while standalone revenue slid 9.3% YoY to ₹32,003 crore. EBITDA declined 2% YoY to ₹18,657 crore.

title: From Tata Motors to Adani: 141 companies see profits & sales decline in Q1. Is your portfolio at risk?
summary: The June quarter earnings season disappointed investors, with many companies reporting simultaneous declines in sales and profit. Despite some sectors like cement and healthcare showing strength, large sectors including IT, financials, and auto experienced weak earnings growth.
fullContent: The June quarter earnings season disappointed investors, with many companies reporting simultaneous declines in sales and profit. Despite some sectors like cement and healthcare showing strength, large sectors including IT, financials, and auto experienced weak earnings growth. Experts remain cautiously optimistic, anticipating a recovery in the second half of FY26, driven by factors like rate cuts and a favorable monsoon.

title: Swiss Likely to End Property Tax, Hit Chalets With New Levy
summary: Switzerland is likely to scrap a century-old tax on real estate and introduce a new levy that will target second homes — such as mountain chalets — to offset any budget shortfalls, according to a poll.
fullContent: Switzerland is likely to scrap a century-old tax on real estate and introduce a new levy that will target second homes — such as mountain chalets — to offset any budget shortfalls, according to a poll.

title: UK’s Crisis-Stricken Statistics Body Faces More Funding Cuts

title: Japan’s Investment in $550 Billion US Fund Could Be More Than 2%
summary: The rate of actual Japanese investment forming part of a $550 billion US fund could be higher than the 1-2% initially cited, Japan’s top negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said in a live television interview on Wednesday.

Sensex jumps over 200 pts, Nifty tops 24,550 on strong global cues; metal stocks rally
summary: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty commenced trading on a positive note, reflecting the upward trend in Asian markets. This surge follows encouraging U.S. retail inflation data, fueling anticipation of a Federal Reserve rate cut in September.
fullContent: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty commenced trading on a positive note, reflecting the upward trend in Asian markets. This surge follows encouraging U.S. retail inflation data, fueling anticipation of a Federal Reserve rate cut in September. Easing domestic price pressures further bolstered investor confidence, contributing to the optimistic market sentiment.
